IGNITE-9978: [ML] Implement Compound Naive Bayes classifier
body:
Compound Naive Bayes over Gaussian and Discrete models.

To implement Compound Naive Bayes,  Gaussian and Discrete models were updated:
* A method `setFeatureIdsToSkip(Collection<Integer> featureIdsToSkip)`  was added to Gaussian and Discrete trainers. The method accepts a collection with feature ids which should be skipped in a trainer. 

* A method `double[] probabilityPowers(Vector vector)` was added to Gaussian and Discrete models.  The method returns an array where the index is a label index and value is a probability power of being this label.

@zaleslaw @ybabak @avplatonov @dmitrievanthony could you take a look?

created, not when first time client api is used. Javadoc used to say the
opposite, removed that.

title: IGNITE-11597 Fix Node.js thin client UUID marshalling
body:
Fixed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IGNITE-11597:

- A bug with UUID marshalling was fixed (endianness when sending/reading to/from cluster needs to be swapped) 
- A test on that bug was added
- package.json was aligned with the one from npmjs.com
- Trailing spaces were removed
- Version bumped up to 1.0.1

title: IGNITE-11828 "operationContextPerCall" is set only during the moment of Ignite binary queue creation
IGNITE-10690: Fixed Ignite unsupported java.time.Instant type
body:
Earlier if some type was supported by H2, but not by Ignite, we got
scary error on select (or put if index is used):  H2 used to say type is
supported, Ignite - that it's not. java.time.Instant is one of them.
 Replaced H2's DataType.getTypeForClass with Ignite's one that returns
JAVA_OBJECT if any type is unsupported by Ignite.

Ignite 2.4.16
IGNITE-11780
Monitoring Proof of concept
body:
Proof of concept for [IEP-35  "Monitoring and profiling"](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=112820392)

* `GridMonitoringManager` - simple implementation of manager to store all monitoring info
* `HttpPullExposerSpi` - pull exposer implementation that can responde with JSON from `http://localhost:8080/ignite/monitoring`. JSON content can be veiwed in [gist](https://gist.github.com/nizhikov/aa1e6222e6a3456472b881b8deb0e24d)
* Compute task start and finish monitored in "compute" list - *** link to monotoring ***
* Service registration are monitored in "service" list - *** link to services ***
* Current `IgniteSpiMBeanAdapter` rewritten using `GridMonitoringManager`

To try locally, please, run `MonitoringSelfTest`

Example of HTTP exposer output:

```
    "COMPUTE": {
      "tasks": {
        "name": "tasks",
        "rows": [
          {
            "id": "0798817a-eeec-4386-9af7-94edb39ffced",
            "sessionId": "a1814f95a61-912451ff-ca7b-4764-a7fd-728f6a900000",
            "data": {
              "taskClasName": "org.apache.ignite.monitoring.MonitoringSelfTest$$Lambda$145/1500885480",
              "startTime": 1556287337944,
              "timeout": 9223372036854776000,
              "execName": null
            },
            "name": "anotherBroadcast"
          },
...
```

IGNITE-11671 Thin client: Client may hang when connected to a starting server
body:
Connection id (long) consists of two 32-bits parts:
1. node order
2. Unique identifier (int)

I removed node order and make unique identifier long type.
Node order was used only for assertion on dropping a connection. Moreover, this assertion fails after 2^31 attempts to connect. 

It fixed NPE on a server side and a client hanging.
